articles.headline: Post-vote politics, payoffs
articles.summary: The article explores the aftermath of the 2004 presidential election, using computer-assisted reporting to investigate campaign contributions and political favors, shedding light on the influences behind the election outcomes.

articles.headline: Mapping, stats show scope of racial bias
articles.summary: The article investigates racial bias in policing through data analysis and mapping, focusing on a case in Cincinnati where a police pursuit led to the death of an unarmed black man, Timothy Thomas, and subsequent riots.

articles.headline: Tallying lost money through farm loophole
articles.summary: Explores how property owners, including major corporations, exploit a farm tax loophole to save millions annually at the expense of city, school, and county tax revenues.

articles.headline: Felon hunters
articles.summary: An article detailing how matching databases revealed that nearly 1,000 felons in Missouri had hunting licenses, prompting legislative consideration to change state laws.

articles.headline: Politics and elections: An evolving story
articles.author_title: NICAR and Missouri School of Journalism
articles.summary: Focuses on the evolving story of politics and elections, emphasizing ongoing journalistic efforts to uncover the dynamics behind voter registration and political contributions using data analysis.
